metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22754 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
If a user installed an extension of a particular type, the extension could have auto-updated itself and while doing so, bypass the prompt which grants the new version the new requested permissions. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 97, Thunderbird < 91.6, and Firefox ESR < 91.6.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22754` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine
